title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: MacKenzie Scott makes more ‘life-changing,’ record-breaking gifts to historically Black colleges and universities—totaling more than $400 million
items.description: These donations come on the heels of other major donations from Scott to HBCUs this fall.

items.title: Self-made millionaire Barbara Corcoran reveals her ‘golden rule’ of real estate investing
items.description: The “Shark Tank” star with a $100 million net worth says paying 20% down is key—and explains why.

items.title: In just 15 years, the average U.S. homebuyer went from 39 to 59 years old: Top analyst reveals how the housing market has warped in one generation
items.description: The first-time homebuyer just hit 40 years old for the first time ever, but the average homebuyer is nearly a senior citizen.

items.title: In the Faroe Islands’ Soccer Team, the Players Also Have Day Jobs
items.description: The Faroe Islands, rugged green specks in the North Atlantic, are an underdog. Most of the guys on the team have day jobs.

items.title: Justice Dept. Struggled to Find Lawyers to Handle Maurene Comey Suit
items.description: Ms. Comey sued the Trump administration after she was abruptly fired over the summer, saying the action was retaliation. Federal attorneys in New York...

items.title: Michelle Obama’s New Book Is a Historical Document Dressed Up as a Coffee-Table Tome
items.description: “The Look” should be studied by generations to come because of what it reveals not about fashion, but about politics.

items.title: The longest government shutdown in history is over—but flights and jobs data won’t return to normalcy yet
items.description: The House passed a bill last night to fund the government through Jan. 30, and President Trump signed it, reopening the federal government.

items.title: Under Fire for Tucker Carlson Remarks, Think Tank Chief Pleads Ignorance
items.description: Kevin Roberts, under fire for defending Tucker Carlson’s interview with a white nationalist, said that he did not keep up with the news and that he ha...

items.title: BofA cites ‘favorable protein economics’ in the chicken restaurant segment with the race  afoot to corner the $67 billion market
items.description: Analysts Sara Senatore and Isaiah Austin also highlighted "menu versatility," as chicken lends itself to both quick-service restaurants and fast casua...

items.title: As Shutdown Ends, When Will SNAP and Air Travel Be Back to Normal?
items.description: Some programs like SNAP could be restored within hours, while other effects could take longer to unravel.

items.title: Bird Flu Ravaged the World’s Largest Elephant Seal Population, Study Finds
items.description: After the H5N1 virus hit the remote island of South Georgia in 2023, more than 50,000 breeding females may have disappeared.

items.title: Man Accused of Running Southeast Asia Scam Compound Is Extradited to China
items.description: China and the United States say She Zhijiang, a Chinese-born businessman, ran a major scam compound in Myanmar. He was arrested in Bangkok in 2022.

items.title: Juan Ponce Enrile, a Political Power in the Philippines, Dies at 101
items.description: A protégé of Ferdinand Marcos, he helped administer martial law for eight years before turning on his patron in the “People Power” uprising of 1986.

items.title: A Man Took a Bus for a Joyride. Turns Out, He’s Not a Bad Driver.
items.description: The incident in Hamilton, Ontario, ended safely with an arrest and no injuries (and all fares paid).

items.description: The Faroe Islands, rugged green specks in the North Atlantic, are an underdog. Most of the guys on the team have day jobs.
